data.title: Split script editor
data.body:
It would be neat to split the code editor in two (at least) horizontally and/or vertically. Sometimes I need to edit more than one script at a time and this would make it easier.

Don't seem so hard to do, but it can wait and be done after 2.1.

(I'm impressed that no one asked this before, or my GH-issue-search-fu failed on me.)

data.title: an universal node able to toggle the visibility of its children
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Official 2.0.3stable win64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

Let's imagine I have a branch in my tree that mixes 2D, 3D and Control nodes.

If the parent node is a 3D node and if I hide it, then only 3D children will be hidden too. All other 2D and Control children will remain visible.

It could be handy  to have an "universal" Node that could hide/show its children even if they are of an other type.

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Feature request - add locking functionality to an object's child nodes from the UI.
data.body:
Linux x64 (Ubuntu 16.04) - Godot built from Git.

Change the "Makes sure the object's children are not selectable" to "Lock the selected object in place and its children" - OR add functionality to the existing lock button to also allow locking any child nodes in place (and/or add "are not selectable" to the parent node as well).

data.title: Source code documentation
data.body:
Hello!
Why godot source code havn't good comments(c++ comments) and documentation (doxygen). Eventually one or two years later, even main developers can't understand functions an classes in a less documented source code.
Blender has a policy in documentation and everyone who wants change some part of code must document and comment his changes carefully.
Do godot engine have a strategy for documenting.
Another question. Do godot engine have enough developers for reviewing?
Here is a sample of blender coding and reviewing workflow:
![review](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14325605/16193614/7aa423e4-3705-11e6-9e03-0d24b6853bfc.png)

data.title: Add resource type and editor plugin for text files
data.body:
Add `RawText` to handle text files as resources.
Add RawTextEditorPlugin to edit text files with code highlight.
![](https://cdn.rawgit.com/Geequlim/depot/master/images/godot/raw_texte_ditor.png)

Supported code highlight:
- Bash Shell
- C/C++
- C#
- CSS
- JSON
- Javascript/ECMAScript 6
- Python
- INI/TOML configuration files
- XML _When `XML_ENABLED` is not defined_
- YAML

data.title: Texscreen does not match screen if game window is resized at runtime.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 8 - Bleeding Edge Version (57c67fb0)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Shaders using 'texscreen' property get messed up if the game window is resized during runtime. The texscreen sample seems to get dealigned with everything. Starting a game up with any resolution does not seem to cause similar problems, only resizing at runtime.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Can be see easily in the texscreen demo by resizing the game window while the game is running. Other undiscernable visual glitches also seem to be present here.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Visible in texscreen demo (https://github.com/godotengine/godot-demo-projects)

data.title: Fix the joystick vibration on Linux
data.body:
My previous pull request ( #5043 ) had two major bugs:
- The timestamp for the _start_ and _stop_ commands were generated using different functions
-  The effects were not removed from the joystick after being uploaded, so the vibration stopped working when the joystick's list of effects was full

Which made the joystick pretty much unusable, except for very basic tests (which is why I discovered these bugs only when I tried to _actually_ use the feature). Sorry about that, I should definitely have tested my code more thoroughly.

TextureRegion improvements

- Edit region and patch9/skylebox margins at the same time.

- Move editor to BottomSplit

**Showcase video:**

data.title: [Android] Magnetometer gets laggy after app suspends and resumes
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

This is only in the master branch where the magnetomatometer code exists. And I wrote the code. Heh...

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

When I push the home key on the phone to go away from the app, then come back to it (like via the multitask key) the temporal precision (apparent sync rate) of get_magnetometer drops to like less than half of what it was when I first launched the app. Tested on 3 different devices. AFAIK this only affects the magnetometer and not the accelerometer, but I could be wrong.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

This thingy below does the skeleton dance due to no temporal smoothing but the bug is still apparent if you follow the steps above.

[vrtest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/322589/vrtest.zip)

data.title: rand_seed has equal random number and new seed
data.body:
The function `rand_seed(int)` returns an array that supposedly contains the returned random number and the new seed. But both are always equal, so there's no reason to return an array.

You can see that this function makes a new seed but returns pretty much the same number (unless the new seed is negative): https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/eff0bd2d48b57855b8895c6798cac7df05851e74/core/math/math_funcs.cpp#L43-L60

There's some `#if 1`'d code, so I guess this function changed but kept returning array for compatibility.

data.title: Fix layout menu labels and shortcuts
Added loop interpolation and track trigger icons
Update of Russian translation (commit 48a7216)
2nd click of double clicking with (left) mouse button gets registered as FALSE for Input.is_action_pressed()
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Fedora 23 KDE - Godot custom build from 5th June 2016

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When double clicking with the left mouse, the 2nd mouse click gets registered as FALSE for Input.is_action_pressed(). Double clicking with a keyboard button works fine, both clicks get registered as TRUE. Surprisingly, this issue just applies to the left mouse button, the right button works as expected.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Download the demo below. make a double click with the arrow-up button and hold the button down after 2nd press. you will notice that the player keeps jumping, so Input.is_action_pressed = TRUE.
retry that with the left mouse button, with keeping the left mouse button pressed after the 2nd click of the double-click. you will notice that the player does not jumps while pressing down the button, so Input.is_action_pressed = FALSE.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Check this game at following commit as a demo:
https://github.com/fry-/juck/tree/383ef70a2c4c5b15d6b8c76b242cb02bbe3bb475
The input logic is in player.gd, at line 30-40.

data.title: Windows 10, godot compiled error.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

When compiled Godot for Windows 10, version 2.1 alpha (f47d7b2) console show this error:
`scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(575): error C2146: syntax error: missing ')' before identifier 'or'
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(575): error C2065: 'or': undeclared identifier
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(575): error C2146: syntax error: missing ';' before identifier 'next_pos'
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(575): error C2059: syntax error: ')'
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(576): error C2059: syntax error: 'if'
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(578): error C2181: illegal else without matching if
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(586): error C3927: '->': trailing return type is not allowed after a non-function declarator
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(586): error C3484: syntax error: expected '->' before the return type
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(586): error C3613: missing return type after '->' ('int' assumed)
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(586): error C4430: missing type specifier - int assumed. Note: C++ does not support default-int
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(586): error C2146: syntax error: missing ';' before identifier 'pos'
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(588): error C2228: left of '.from' must have class/struct/union
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(588): note: type is 'int'
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(588): error C2228: left of '.pos' must have class/struct/union
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(588): note: type is 'int'
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(588): error C2065: 'delta': undeclared identifier
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(588): error C2065: 'p_blend': undeclared identifier
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(588): error C2065: 'playback': undeclared identifier
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(588): error C2228: left of '.current' must have class/struct/union
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(588): note: type is 'unknown-type'
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(588): error C4430: missing type specifier - int assumed. Note: C++ does not support default-int
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(588): error C2440: 'initializing': cannot convert from 'initializer list' to 'int'
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(588): note: The initializer contains too many elements
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(592): error C2059: syntax error: '}'
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(592): error C2143: syntax error: missing ';' before '}'
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(593): error C2143: syntax error: missing ';' before '{'
scene\animation\animation_player.cpp(593): error C2447: '{': missing function header (old-style formal list?)
scons: *** [scene\animation\animation_player.windows.tools.32.obj] Error 2
scons: building terminated because of errors.
`

In file "scene\animation\animation_player.cpp" need change line 575 "if (next_pos<0 or next_pos>len) {" to "if (next_pos<0 || next_pos>len) {" 
and in file file "scene\resources\animation.cpp" need change line 1238 "if (loop and loop_interpolation) {" to "if (loop && loop_interpolation) {"

data.title: The state of Ctrl+S
data.body:
I find myself often editing a script, hit Ctrl+S to save it. But then, a few unexpected things happen:

1) When I want to commit my work in Git I find that the last opened .tscn scene was modified. After reading diffs, it shows random line order changes, but technically the files are identical.

2) So it means Godot saves the current scene when I use Ctrl+S, even when the scene is unmodified. If the scene is large, it might even slow down the process. I would expect not saving something that I didn't touched, or better, just save what I see (the script), not two files at a time.

I remember there is a separate shortcut for saving scripts. Now we can edit shortcuts, but these two are still separate and have to be different...
IMO it doesn't feels right. It should be possible to have a contextual save shortcut that saves only what there is on the focused panel (scene, script, shader...).

data.title: Import issues (tested with audio sample)
data.body:
Tested on Windows 10 64 bits, commit bd79aa52ab2ef7eec4cad55d373b6e4fc7de7731

1) I tried to import a WAV audio sample. The editor allows me to choose a target path, but creating a folder is impossible. It just says "Could not create folder". So I put the sound at `res://`.

2) Once the sound is imported, I cannot play it, and the waveform preview in the inspector is fully black.

3) When opening the file .smp file with a text editor, I can see the path to the original WAV file, as a full path. If this is what I think it is, I expected a relative path, because otherwise it makes the project impossible to share.
That last one was initially the reason why I opened the issue, but other problems were in the way so I added them here.

Project as it is after doing the things above: 
[ImportPathTest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/322058/ImportPathTest.zip)

Note: I see the sound is automatically re-imported when I modify its source. Is there a way to disable it?
